In the original Windows 7, that you find (download) yourself at Microsoft, Windows 7 Ultimate are included HomeBasic, HomePremium, Professional and Ultimate.
You can install the version you want!
I added offline only updates and I tested Windows to virtual machine to see if updates are integrated.

@RenanRischiotto: When you boot from DVD with this Windows you could choose which version you want, because this one contains Home Basic, Home Premium, Professional and Ultimate. Just pick the one that suits your taste. Those are all 64-bit of course, but there is a 32-bit version also. Just google 64 & 32-bit and you will probably find what version suits you the best. If you have a 64-bit CPU the 64-bit version of Windows (this one) is probably the one you would prefer since it can address more memory and therefore better performance.

for those who does not know what is 32 and 64 bit

Windows 7 32 bit = 3.75 gb to 4 gb of RAM limitattions..

Windows 7 64 bit = 4 gb to 12 gb of RAM and depends on your motherboard configuration.and your  CPU (processor) must be 64 bit capable usually dual core and quadcore.(core i3. i5, i7)
1st gen,2nd gen, and the newer 3rd gen. if you are using one these processor better to use  64 bit to have optimal performance!
